misuse: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
vulnerable_code: byte[] bytes = new byte[length]; for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) { bytes[i] = RandomUtil.randomByte(); } return bytes;
description: The method RandomUtil.randomBytes() generates random bytes by calling RandomUtil.randomByte(), which in turn generates a random integer and converts it to a byte. This can lead to a lack of entropy and a higher risk of predictability in the random byte array.
recommendation: Use a cryptographically secure random number generator to generate the random bytes, such as SecureRandom.getInstanceStrong().
